ch.iserver.ace.util
Class IsolatedThreadDomain

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.util.IsolatedThreadDomain
All Implemented Interfaces:
ThreadDomain
public class IsolatedThreadDomain
extends Object

ThreadDomain that creates a new worker thread per invocation of the wrap(Object, Class) method. When an IsolatedThreadDomain is created it is important to pass in a ReferenceQueue which is also passed to a WorkerCollector. See the following code for an example: 

  ReferenceQueue queue = new ReferenceQueue();
  ThreadDomain domain = new IsolatedThreadDomain(queue);
  WorkerCollector collector = new WorkerCollector(queue);
  Thread thread = new Thread(collector);
  thread.start();
Of course you can schedule the execution of the collector on a separate thread.

See Also:
ReferenceQueue

wrap

public Object wrap(Object target,
                   Class clazz,
                   boolean ignoreVoidMethods)
Description copied from interface: ThreadDomain
Wraps the target object so that calls to it are executed in this ThreadDomain. The ignoreNonVoidMethods parameter determines whether the async interceptor is applied to methods having a void return type.

Parameters:
target - the target object
clazz - the interface implemented by the target object
ignoreVoidMethods - do not invoke non-void return typed methods asynchronously
Returns:
the wrapped object

ThreadDomain.wrap(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Class, boolean)

wrap

protected Object wrap(Object target,
                      Class clazz,
                      edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue queue)
Wraps the given target object and returns a proxy that implements the specified interface clazz. It is thus safe to cast the returned object to the specified class. The queue serves as target for the AsyncInterceptor that intercepts all the calls to the target object.

Parameters:
target - the target object to be wrapped
clazz - the interface the proxy should implement
queue - the queue used to queue MethodInvocation objects
Returns:
a dynamic proxy wrapping the given target object
